Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a healthy and growing plant with plenty of water and light.
The student can draw a plant wilting or not growing well without water.
The student can draw a plant wilting or not growing well without light.
The student can use clear and simple symbols or labels to indicate the presence of water and light in the drawing with a healthy plant.
The student can use clear and simple symbols or labels to indicate the absence of water or light in drawings showing plants not growing well.
The student can illustrate a comparison between a well-cared-for plant and one lacking resources, highlighting differences in growth and health.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally forget to label one of the plants correctly (e.g., missing label for 'no light').
The student might show minor inconsistencies in the symbols used, such as using different symbols for the same concept across drawings (e.g., inconsistent symbols for light).
